title: Bitcoin hits new all-time record high
byline: Bitcoin hit a new record high on Monday as the world’s largest cryptocurrency by market value continued to benefit from strong investor demand.

title: Shoe thrown at India’s Chief Justice in religious row
byline: An Indian lawyer has thrown a shoe at the country’s Chief Justice BR Gavai after apparently being angered by remarks the judge made about Hinduism.

title: Showers or thundershowers expected in most places of the island after 1pm
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most places of the island after 1.00 p.m. today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Convention against Doping in Sport Amendment Bill to be debated in Parliament today
byline: The second reading of the Convention against Doping in Sport (Amendment) Bill is scheduled to take place in Parliament today (07).

title: Bodies of couple hacked to death found in a house in Hungama
byline: The bodies of a couple hacked to death with sharp weapons have been discovered in a house in Wadigala, Hungama, police stated.

title: US government shutdown enters second week after funding measures fail again in Senate
byline: The US government shutdown entered its second week on Monday (Oct 6), with no sign of a deal between President Donald Trump’s Republicans and Democrats to end the crisis.

title: Judicial Service Commission decides to withhold several allowances for suspended judges
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has decided to pay only partial salaries to judges currently under suspension and to withhold several allowances that they would normally be entitled to.

title: Taylor Swift’s new album breaks her own sales records
byline: Taylor Swift’s latest album, The Life of a Showgirl, has already secured the UK’s biggest opening week of 2025, after selling 304,000 copies since Friday.

title: Chinese EV giant BYD sees UK sales soar by 880%
byline: Chinese car making giant BYD says the UK has become its biggest market outside China, after its sales there surged by 880% in September compared to a year earlier.

title: Several houses damaged by strong winds in Welikanda
byline: Several houses in Mahindagama within the Welikanda Divisional Secretariat Division in Polonnaruwa have been partially damaged or destroyed due to strong winds last evening (06).

title: Gold set to become Australia’s second-biggest resource earner
byline: Australia said on Tuesday it expected gold to become its second most valuable resource export after iron ore this financial year, dislodging liquefied natural gas, as concerns over geopolitical instability fuel demand for the safe-haven metal.

title: Indians lead drop in US university visas
byline: The United States issued nearly one-fifth fewer student visas in August following a crackdown by President Donald Trump, led by a steep drop for India which was overtaken by China as top country of origin, data showed Monday.

title: 28,000 individuals subjected to inspection during island-wide police operation
byline: A total of 719 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (06).

title: GMOA Executive Committee meeting called to discuss transfer issues
byline: An emergency executive committee meeting of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) is scheduled to be held today (07).

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs requests to serve sentence at low-level New Jersey jail
byline: Sean “Diddy” Combs’ lawyers want the hip-hop mogul sent to a low-security federal prison in New Jersey to serve his four-year, two-month prison sentence, telling a judge Monday that the facility’s drug treatment program will help him stay clean.

title: Local gold price hits historic high after sharp rise in global rates
byline: The price of gold has surpassed USD 3,950 per ounce for the first time in history, global market data indicates.

title: US ends universal Covid-19 vaccine recommendation, leaves decision to patients
byline: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has implemented recommendations from a newly appointed panel of vaccine advisers.

title: Suspect remanded over multiple crimes including murder
byline: An individual arrested on suspicion of multiple crimes, including murder, has been remanded until October 21, police stated.

title: Main suspect in brutal double murder in Hungama arrested
byline: A main suspect and three others have been arrested in connection with the brutal killing of a couple using sharp weapons at a house in Wadigala, Hungama.

title: Airline accused of killing ‘strict vegetarian’ Sri Lankan passenger with meat-based meal: Report
byline: A Southern California cardiologist flying Qatar Airways from Los Angeles to Sri Lanka was denied the vegetarian meal he had ordered, then died after choking on a piece of food while attempting to “eat around” the meat in meal he was given instead, according to his grieving family.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic recovery remains incomplete, World Bank says
byline: Despite Sri Lanka’s strong economic performance in recent times, the recovery remains incomplete, with growth still below pre-crisis levels and poverty significantly elevated, the World Bank said.

title: Sri Lanka rejects resolution presented to UN Human Rights Council
byline: Sri Lanka, while disagreeing with coercive international action, rejected the resolution 60/L.1/Rev.1 presented to the United Nations Human Rights Council in Genève.

title: Israelis mark 2 years since October 7 Hamas attacks
byline: Israel marks the second anniversary of the October 7, 2023 attack on Tuesday, as Hamas and Israeli negotiators hold indirect talks to end the two-year war in Gaza under a US proposed peace plan.

title: Mahinda Amaraweera visits ex-President Rajapaksa in Tangalle
byline: Former Minister Mahinda Amaraweera visited former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at Carlton House in Tangalle today (07).

title: Vehicles assigned for security of former presidents can be returned if requested: Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala says that although the Former Presidents’ Entitlements Act has been repealed, this does not mean that necessary measures will not be taken to ensure their security.

title: Contempt of Court case filed against YouTuber Sudaththa Thilaksiri to be taken up before Appeals Court
byline: The Court of Appeal today (07) ordered that the petition filed by former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara against YouTuber Sudaththa Thilaksiri, alleging contempt of court, be taken up on December 2 for reconsideration.

title: World Bank warns US tariffs on Indian exports to slow South Asia growth next year
byline: The World Bank on Tuesday said higher tariffs on Indian goods exported to the U.S. will drag the South Asian growth rate in 2026, even as the current year remains shielded by government spending.

title: Three scientists win Nobel Prize in physics for work on quantum mechanics
byline: Three scientists at American universities won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for their work on quantum mechanics.

title: Supreme Court upholds death sentence on ‘Julampitiye Amare’
byline: The Supreme Court today (07) dismissed, without proceeding to a hearing, the appeal filed by G.G. Amarasiri, also known as ‘Julampitiye Amare’, against the death sentence imposed on him following a conviction for murder.

title: Seven children hospitalised after being exposed to chemical substance in a school lab
byline: Seven children have been hospitalised after being exposed to a chemical substance in a laboratory of a school in Dambulla.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.6 shakes Lae city in Papua New Guinea
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.6 struck near Lae, the second largest city in Papua New Guinea, on Tuesday, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) said.

title: CIABOC launches new case tracking system to enhance transparency and efficiency
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) marked a major step in institutional modernization with the launch of its new Case Tracking System at the CIABOC Auditorium today (07).

title: President meets IMF delegation to discuss Sri Lanka’s fifth review
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with the delegation of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) at the Presidential Secretariat this morning to discuss the fifth review of the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) program for Sri Lanka, according to the President’s Office.

title: Convention against Doping in Sport (Amendment) Bill passed in Parliament
byline: The Speaker of Sri Lanka’s Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, today (07) endorsed the certificate on the Convention against Doping in Sport (Amendment) Bill.

title: Chinese community in SL makes donation in support of Na Uyana Monastery following tragic accident
byline: In the wake of the tragic accident at the Na Uyana Monastery in Malsiripura, Kurunegala District, the Chinese Community in Sri Lanka has extended a heartfelt gesture of solidarity and compassion toward the victims and the monastic community.

title: Opposition MPs submit motion seeking probe into release of 323 containers
byline: A motion seeking to appoint a special parliamentary committee to investigate the release of 323 shipping containers from the Colombo Port without mandatory physical inspection has been submitted to the Speaker of Parliament.

title: “Complete abandonment of Sri Lanka’s inclusive nationalistic vision” – Dilith slams govt over UN resolution
byline: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ leader and Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera today demanded immediate answers from the government for the “shocking betrayal” of Sri Lanka’s allies who stood with the country against UNHRC resolutions.

title: AIIB reaffirms support for Sri Lanka’s green energy and development goals
byline: The President of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB), Jin Liqun, affirmed AIIB’s commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s development, particularly in the promotion of the green energy sector.
